fields.Title of Contribution: On First Order Partial Differential-Functional Inequalities
fields.Description/Abstract: Suppose that f:E×R×C(E0?E,R)×Rn ?R, where E0,E?R1+n are given sets. Differential-functional	inequalities Dxz(x, y) ? f(x, y, z(x, y), z, Dyz(x, y)) = P[z](x,y) ? 0, (x,y) ? IntE, are considered, where Dyz = (Dy1z,···,Dynz) and z denotes an element of the space of continuous functions from E0 ? E to R. We prove the following result. Suppose that P[u](x,y) ? 0 and P[v](x,y) ? 0 on IntE. If u(x,y) ? v(x,y) on the initial set E0 then under certain conditions concerning f and E we have u(x, y) ? v(x, y) on E. Our result is a generalization of previous results on first-order partial differential or differential-functional inequalities. It is an essential fact in our considerations that f satisfies the Volterra condition and that it is nondecreasing with respect to the functional argument.
